data.title: Anna Lee
authors: Contributors to Ultimate Soap Fan Wiki
data.meta_description: Anna Lee began appearing on daytime in 1978 as Lila Quartermaine on General Hospital. Lee would portray the role until 2003 when she was let go when a behind the scenes change happened. Lee's sons noted that her health increasingly declined after being let go from the show. Lee passed on May 14...
data.text:
Birth Name

Joan Boniface Winnifrith

Birthdate

January 2, 1913

Birthplace

Ightham, Kent, England, UK

Date of Death

May 14, 2004 (age 91)

Cause of Death

pneumonia

Occupation

Actress

Years Active

1993-2003

Anna Lee began appearing on daytime in 1978 as Lila Quartermaine on General Hospital. Lee would portray the role until 2003 when she was let go when a behind the scenes change happened. Lee's sons noted that her health increasingly declined after being let go from the show. Lee passed on May 14, 2004 at the age of 91. Lee was paralyzed from the waist down after a car accident. Lee appeared in several TV series and feature films during her long career.

Personal Life[]

Lee was married three times. Lee's first marriage was to Robert Stevenson (1934-1944) and they had two children: Joanna Venetia Invicta (b. 03/10/1938) and Caroline. Lee married her second husband, George Stafford in 1944 and divorced in 1964. They had three children: John, Stephen and Timothy Paul (b. 11/28/1955). Tim acts under the name Jeffrey Byron and has appeared on The Bold and the Beautiful and One Life to Live. Lee's third marriage was to Robert Nathan from April 5, 1970 until his death on May 25, 1985.

Soapography[]

Lila Quartermaine on General Hospital (1978-05/30/2003)

Lila Quartermaine on Port Charles (Between 1997 and 2003)

Awards and Nominations[]

Daytime Emmy Awards

Year Category W/N 2004 Lifetime Achivement Award W

Soap Opera Digest Awards

Year Category Character/Series W/N 1988 Outstanding Actress in a Supporting Role: Daytime Lila Quartermaine, General Hospital W

Soapy Awards

Year Category Character/Series W/N 1983 Favorite Women in a Mature Role Lila Quartermaine, General Hospital W

Hollywood Walk of Fame

Star awarded on January 7, 1993 at 6777 Hollywood Blvd.
